result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mackenzie Cheryl Shultis

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on December 19, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mackenzie Cheryl Shultis in court.  Attorney Luke K Harrison appeared by video for Mackenzie Cheryl Shultis.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint and reserves all other jurisdictional rights and objections. 
Not guilty plea(s).  Jury calendar. 
Offer deadline: 11-04-2022
Order to report to TRPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct and bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 09-29-22 at 10:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety unless recommended or being treated by a physician.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
